forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy. Low around 56, with temperatures rising to around 58 overnight. South southwest wind around 16 mph, with gusts as high as 26 mph. Chance of precipitation is 80%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Sunday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy. High near 59, with temperatures falling to around 57 in the afternoon. South wind 15 to 23 mph, with gusts as high as 33 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between three quarters and one inch possible.

weather_report:
In the heart of Downtown San Francisco, a sultry mist blankets the city, heralding a night of persistent rain that casts an almost ethereal glow on the streets. The temperature is a cool embrace, hovering in the mid-50s, while gusts from the south, spirited at 16 to 23 mph, weave through the empty passages. As the night deepens, the rain whispers a promise of a quarter to half an inch of solace, delicately kissing the earth. The chance of precipitation looms heavily in the air, sitting at 80%, inviting quiet reflection and perhaps a cozy evening indoors. 

As dawn breaks, shadows of clouds linger over the skyline, dark and brooding but utterly captivating. The rain continues its relentless dominance, engulfing the landscape in a moist embrace. The high will barely touch 59, slowly ebbing to the cooler tail of the day. Expect an inch of rain, drumming a relentless beat against the rooftops, merging city sounds into a calming symphony of nature and urbanity. Perhaps today is not meant for the bustling coffee shops or vibrant galleries. Instead, grab a warm jacket before seeking refuge in the nearest bookstore or library, losing yourself in stories and memories. Alternatively, sip on an intricate brew at a café as the world outside slips into a watercolor of grey, a reminder of the warmth found in life’s little corners.
